instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-2936: What is 820-2936? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> 3 long tones, 3 short tones, 3 long tones efi issue
threads.message: got a board in with 3 long tones, 3 short tones, 3 long tones. i cannot get into the computer to know what version of efi it has.  not sure if it should be automatic or if it need the disk. so i tried to run efi restore 1.9 it takes the disk runs it and then spits it out.  any ideas?  it looks like the board might have had a slight amount of liquid but nothing obvious.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> 3 long tones, 3 short tones, 3 long tones efi issue
threads.message: Just pull the chip and post the dump here to be fixed.
